loans.name: Nadir Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NADIR” iniciará el  primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Soraya es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de ropa, venta de polleras y mantas, pastelería, venta de cosméticos, productos de belleza, venta de ropa usada, venta de joyas y material de plata.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Soraya es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de ropa, ella nos cuenta que hace varios años emprendió este negocio por iniciativa propia y con ayuda de su madre. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa) que comprará de las comerciantes por mayor y posteriormente lo comercializará en las ciudades de Potosi y Oruro. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el personal.
texts.en:
The Nadir communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has seven members led by a governing board headed by Soraya, the president.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them are: clothing sales, skirt and blanket sales, pastry making, cosmetics sales, beauty products sales, used clothes sales, sale of silver jewelry and other silver items.

The loan they will take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Soraya.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year and a half ago having been invited by a girlfriend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling clothes and she relates that she started the business several years ago on her own initiative and with her mother’s help.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy clothes from wholesalers and then resell it in the cities of Potosí and Oruro.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family the best way possible since she’s married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the staff.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Virgen De La O Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE LA O ”; Este banco se ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, distrito de Yucay, departamento de Cusco.

La  socia es la Sra. Jesusa; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 06 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de artesania,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio, la socia vende lo que son polos, mantas, chompas, guantes, chuyos entre otros, la socia vende en un hotel de Yucay a los turistas que le solicitan, ella trabaja todos los días durante el día, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de chompas de alpaca.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la confección de ropa, agricultura, compra y venta de maiz, venta de hortalizas, venta de leche, ganadería.

La socia agradece  el préstamo  y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Virgen de la O” communal bank which is located in Urubamba Province, Yucay District, Cusco Department.  

Jesusa, 47, has a spouse and six children.  She alternates her daily chores with a business buying and selling crafts.  She’s been in business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her business.  She sells shirts, blankets, sweaters, gloves and caps, among others.  She sells in a hotel in Yucay to tourists that request her wares.  She works every day during the day.  She’s a responsible, dedicated person and this is the way she supports her family.  She’s requesting the loan to buy alpaca sweaters.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments.

The other group members make clothes, work in agriculture, are corn merchants, sell vegetables, milk and raise cattle.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn, 45 and divorced, supports her three school-going children. For the past fifteen years she has operated her beauty salon and presently makes 10,000 KES a month.

Everlyn has applied for a 30000 KES loan through KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy a salon sink and more stock for her salon like weaves and braids.

Everlyn will use her anticipated profits to further stock her salon and hopes to make life more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to buy a sink and more stock for her salon.

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
El Sr.Osvaldo, vive en el barrio San Isidro en casa propia y es soltero.
Tiene un pequeña despensa y verdulería en su domicilio hace dos años,así ayuda a su familia a salir adelante, la que desea agrandar mas adelante y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos.
Solicitó el crédito para la compra de golosinas atendiendo que su local está frente a una escuela de la zona, además de bebidas, lácteos, panificados entre otros.
texts.en:
Osvaldo lives in the San Isidro neighborhood in his own house.  He is single.

He has had a small grocery store and vegetable shop in his house for two years.  This way he helps his family get ahead.  Later on he wants to expand it and be able to offer a greater variety of products.

He requested the loan to buy candy as his place is front of a school in the area.  He will also buy drinks, dairy products, and baked goods, among others.

loans.use: to buy candy, dairy products, and baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Tabitha Nzasu

texts.en:
Tabitha is applying for her fourth loan term with KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, and maize meal. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand and open a general shop.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, and maize meal for sale

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Eva is in her late 30's, single and has one child who is still in school. She has been selling clothes, rice and running a genge business (a stand that sells fruits and vegetables) for six years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock of her genge business and cover household expenses; she paid back her previous loan successfully. She wants a second loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for her genge business. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Blue, which totals 16 members whom will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ronald Edinho

texts.es:
El socio Ronald pertenece al banco comunal “SANTO DOMINGO” y sus reuniones son cada treinta días en el distrito de Cusco perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento del Cusco.

El socio Ronald tiene 24 años de edad y es soltero, él es natural de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, él trabaja en una entidad privada en el área de logística. Ya son dos meses que trabaja en esa entidad y le va muy bien. Además, Ronald es guía de turismo y en sus horas libres trabaja guiando turistas en los circuitos turísticos de la ciudad el Cusco. En esta oportunidad  requiere el préstamo para uso personal pues va pagar el agua y luz de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ronald is a member of the “Santo Domingo” communal bank that meets monthly in Cusco District belonging to Cusco Province and Department.  He’s 24-years-old and single.  He works for a private firm in the logistics area.  He’s been employed there for two months and is doing very well.  

Ronald is a tourist guide and works in his free time works guiding tourists along the city of Cusco’s tourism routes.  On this occasion he needs the loan for personal use because he will pay his home water and electricity bills.

loans.use: to pay his water and light bills.

loans.name: Bayartogoo

texts.en: Bayartogoo lives with his wife and two sons in a small house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar city. His wife helps him operate his business. His older son is a secondary school student and his younger one is 1 year old. Bayartogoo has prior business experience in the canteen business. Last year he started a sports clothing shop in a rented space along the central road. His family is building a new house within their fence and the weather will be getting cold soon so they need insulation for the new house. Therefore, he is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase an electric heater and insulation for his house. He is an honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase an electric heater and insulation for his house.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: La Sra. Marcelina  es casada tiene 48 años  de edad y tiene 4 hijos, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “Unidos para triunfar” grupo  conformado por  11  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Marcelina se dedica al servicio de bordar es decir trabaja bordando, tejiendo y pegando lentejuelas. Marcelina  inicio este negocio con un capital, compro material necesario para iniciar este negocio y ya cuenta con clientes fidelizados, Marcelina nos cuenta que es una persona muy creativa y eso le ayudara a salir adelante con su negocio, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijos van a la escuela, se ha comprado artefactos eléctricos ,Marcelina  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercaderia es decir (lentejuelas, hilos etc). Marcelina cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece el préstamo a Edaprospo y kiva.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 48 years old. She is married and has four children. She is currently a member of the communal bank Unidos para Triunfar (United to Succeed). The group is made up of 11 members who engage in various commercial activities. 

Marcelina works in embroidery services, that is to say, she embroiders, knits and applies sequins. Marcelina started this business with capitalpurchasing the materials needed to start the business, and she now has loyal customers. Marcelina tells us that she is a very creative person, and this will help her succeed in her business. Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to attain a better income. Her children go to school and she has bought electrical appliances. 

Marcelina is requesting a new loan to buy merchandise such as sequins, thread, etc. Marcelina will meet her goals with hard work and effort and she is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: to buy sequins, thread, etc.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña María de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, siempre ha apoyado a su familia, lo que inicio con la venta de cereales en pinol, pinolillo, cereal, semilla de jícaro, luego con la venta de tortillas, pero debido a su salud, deja de palmear y consigue un trabajo de conserje con los beneficios del seguro y su dinero mensual fijo. Su esposo labora en un hospital en bodega, el hijo menor de 20 años aun vive con ellos, trabaja y estudia contabilidad aportando a los gastos básicos del hogar.
María se ha  ayudado mucho con los créditos en Afodenic, siendo su casita de madera,  hoy en día es de concreto con ocho ciclos que ah trabajado, el crédito anterior avanzo una parte del muro en el extremo de enfrente, hoy con este nuevo préstamo seguirá avanzando atrás, ya que al fondo hay una  casa de zinc, que se le está metiendo en su terreno y las aguas que lavan le están perjudicando ya que se le hace charco, produciendo muchos mosquito es por tal razón comenzara la obra, comprara; piedra, arena. Cemento, hierro y tablas de madera
texts.en:
María is 45 years old.  She is a very hardworking woman and she has always supported her family.  To that end, she started selling toasted corn meal cereal, corn starch, cereal, and calabash tree seeds, and then she sold tortillas.  However, for health reasons she no longer makes tortillas and she found work as a receptionist where she has benefits and set monthly pay.  Her husband works at a small store in a hospital and their youngest son, who is 20, works and studies accounting, contributing to the household expenses.

The loans from AFODENIC have helped María a great deal.  When she started out, her small home was made of wood; now, after eight loan cycles, it is made of concrete.  With her last loan, she extended part of the wall on the far side of the front of her home.  Now, with this new loan, she will extend it back, as behind her there is a small house made of corrugated metal that is encroaching on her property and whose runoff water is harmful to her because it collects in a pool where mosquitoes breed.  This is why she will start work and buy gravel, sand, cement, iron, and wood planks.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a wall at the back of her property

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 78 years old and widowed with five children. To earn a living, she practices dairy farming.  She has been in the business for over ten years.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has improved her business because she has been trained on business management skills. She has also managed to access financial resources easily.
Mary hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She needs 100,000 KES to add dairy cows to her farm.

loans.use: to add dairy cows to her farm.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a 47-year-old mixed crop farmer. She is married to Benson, a business man. They are blessed with four children. She has been in the farming business for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 6,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Priscilla will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Emilia Elisabeth

texts.es: Emilia es originaria de Jinotega pero  habita en la ciudad capital, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, ella es comerciante, propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 4 años. Ella cuenta que inicio su negocio por que vio que el lugar donde ella vive era muy bueno para abrir una pulpería ya que era muy transitado por los habitantes del lugar, asi que decidió invertir su tiempo y dinero en este negocio apoyada por una familiar. Hace 4 años abrió su pulpería, negocio que ha sido de mucho provecho para su familia y para los habitantes del sector. Hoy día ella esta solicitando un crédito para compra de productos como: lácteos, gaseosas, carnes, embutidos y granos básicos. Este préstamo le será de mucho préstamo por que podrá agregar a su inventario mas productos que son de mucha demanda  para sus clientes incrementando  de esta manera sus ventas y  sus ganancias. Sus planes futuros son mejorar su casa y convertir su negocio en una miscelánea que pueda abastecer la mayor parte del sector.
texts.en: Emilia is from Jinotega but lives in the capital city.  She is 31-years-old, married, and a businesswoman who has owned her own grocery store for four years.  She tells us that she began her business because she saw that the place where she lived was a really good place to open a grocery store as many local people pass by it, and thus she decided to invest her time and money in this business with the support of a family member.  Four years ago she opened her grocery store, a business which has been a great advantage for her family and for the people who live in her area.  Today she is requesting a loan to buy products like: dairy products, sodas, meats, canned goods, and grains.  This loan will be very useful for adding more products that are in demand to her inventory  for her customers, in this way increasing her sales and earnings.  Her future plans are to improve her house and to turn her business into a larger shop that can serve the greater part of the area.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, sodas, meat, canned goods, and grains.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is a 26-year-old clothes dealer in Miritini, Mombasa. He is married and has been selling clothes for the past two years with success.

This marks his first business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, wrappers, tee shirts, dresses, and trousers. He will use the anticipated profits to open another clothing shop. 

He hopes to excel in this business and in life.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, wrappers, tee shirts, dresses, and trousers.

loans.name: Munhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Munhbaatar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a small house in the Han-Uul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He and his wife started their clothing making business in August 2012. His wife, Oyundari, who is 31 years old, has worked in a local sewing factory for nine years. They sell their product in a local store by renting a stall. Mr. Munhbaatar now has many regular customers, and they are trying to run their business successfully. They are planning to deliver their product to their customers. Therefore, Ganbold wants to buy a hybrid car for his business. He is hardworking and a smart person. He needs 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a hybrid car for his business.

loans.use: to purchase a hybrid car to deliver their clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Alicia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 27-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of one child. She has been running a retail shop for the past five years with a monthly income of KES 3,300, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her fifth loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Zipporah will use the loan to purchase more stocks of sugar, maize meal, and wheat flour. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hope and dream is to open a general shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of sugar, maize meal, and wheat flour.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 32 years old, married, and has four children. He sells secondhand shoes to earn a living. He has been operating the business for three years and has employed two people. He also does farming to earn extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business because he has been trained on business management skills.
David hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.use: to add to his stock of shoes.

loans.name: Sr. De Cany Cruz - Chilca Group

texts.es:
Katty es una joven de 21 años, soltera con 2 hijos, el primero está estudiando en la escuela y el menor aún tiene 2 años.
Ella se dedica a la venta de de sándwich  y gaseosas de de manera ambulatoria por las principales calles de la ciudad; empezó con este negocio hace más de 6 años cuando tenía tan solo 15 años, empezó apoyando a su madre, ya que eran muchos hermanos y con los ingresos únicos de su padre no se abastecían.
El sueño que ella tiene es el de poder estudiar una carrera técnica, ya que muy jovencita tuvo que hacerse responsable de su hijo.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de un pequeño modulo con rueda y así poder trasladarse por más calles ofreciendo sus sándwiches.
Katty pertenece al grupo Sr. De Cany Cruz, que lleva ya más de 1 año formado, están  iniciando su 4 ciclo, todas son mujeres que luchan por un futuro mejor para ellas y sus hijos.
Katty viste una chompa ploma con capucha, es la tercera de la derecha.*En la foto superior se encuentra Lourdes
texts.en:
Katty is a 21-year-old young woman, single, with two children, the oldest is in school and the youngest is only two years old.
She is a street vendor that sells sandwiches and sodas around the city, she started this business more than six years ago, when she was only 15, she started helping her mom because she had many siblings and her father's income was not sufficient.
Her dream is to attend a technical school, because when she was very young she had to be responsible for her son.
The loan requested is to buy a small cart with wheels so that she can get to more streets offering the sandwiches.
Katty belongs to the group “Sr. De Cany Cruz” which was formed a year ago and is starting its 4th cycle, they are all women that fight for a better future for them and their children. Katty is wearing a sweater, she is the third from the right. In the photo above is Lourdes.

loans.use: to buy a street cart with wheels.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is 62 years old, widowed and has children all above the age of eighteen. She also has grandchildren whom she takes care of.

Peris oversees three businesses. She has a farm and a posho mill, a machine that grinds wheat and maize into flour. For the past five years she has also owned rental housing from which she gets 31,500 KES a month.

Peris has a good credit history with KADET LTD. She’s now applying for her third loan, this one for 100,000 KES with which she plans to buy a cow and more maize for milling.

Peris will use the anticipated profits from these investments to build more rental housing. Her ambition is to buy a ranch and continue building more rentals.

loans.use: to buy a cow and more maize for milling.

loans.name: Anis

texts.en:
This is Anis, a 52-year-old Lebanese, single man. He lives with his only parent. Anis started to work on his own while looking forward to managing the family’s household expenses. Anis specializes in electricity in cars. He became an expert in his domain after gaining very good experience. He has been involved in this profession for twenty-four years.

Today, he’s asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new electrical tools and supplies with the needed quantity of spare car parts. His big interest toward his profession will develop the way he works. This is also the reason why he would like to expand his business: to earn superior income and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase new electrical tools and supplies with the needed quantity of spare car parts.

loans.name: Moon Lom Group

texts.en:
MOON Lom is the creation of five like-minded mothers who believe in their capability to transform the lives of their family through hard work and dedication. Moon Lom was formed in the year 2010.

Thiannu (the one with the raised hand on the right corner) is a mother of two children; both children attend school in her village. She is 40 years old and her husband is a labourer at the only running saw mill factory near her village. Thiannu at first was running a grocery cum variety shop in the village.
 
On 15th of June 2006, she gave birth to a baby girl through a Caesarean operation that compelled her to close her variety shop as she devoted herself to taking care of the baby. She gave birth to a boy in 2008 which further occupied her time with household chores and nurturing both the children while the family expenditures were met only through her husband’s meagre salary.

Thiannu started accessing loans from WSDS in 2010. She started her second-hand clothes business by hanging the clothes out on the roadside near her house. Sometimes, children on her back, she carries her clothes and visits nearly villages selling her goods house to house.

Now, as both the children are attending school (the girl in class-B, and the boy in Preparatory class) she plans to start afresh by expanding her second-hand clothing business with this loan from KIVA. Thiannu’s income from the business will add to the family income and bring better health and education to both the children.

loans.use: to expand her second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Abejitas De Collpani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ABEJITAS DE COLLPANI” iniciará el  vigésimo tercero ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por Ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de condimentos, venta de ropa, venta de quinua, chuño y papa, tejido y venta de chompas, venta de pollos, venta de jugos y batidos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de su hermana que es socias de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio carpintería, ella nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de la familia de su esposo y cuando se caso lo trabajaron juntos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que comprará de las barracas por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a  pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The non-profit "Abejitas de Collpani" (Little Bees of Collpani) will begin its 23rd cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the Collpani Center.  The group is made up of eight members and is directed by a board led by the president, Julia.  The businesses led by members of the communal association are varied and include: food sales, clothing sales, quinoa sales, potato and potato starch sales, knitting and selling sweaters, chicken sales, and juice and smoothie sales.

The loan that they will take out will benefit the small business owners like Julia.  She tells us that a year and a half ago she joined Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of her sister who is a member of the group.  Currently she has a carpentry business.  She learned the business from her husband's family and when they married began to work together.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital and buy wood which she gets from small huts at wholesale prices and which she will then sell based on orders.  This form of work allows her to earn money to support her family in everything as she is married with two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the health aspect.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has used clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Alicia has been in this business for 12 years. Alicia earns more income from selling vegetables.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 35 years old and married with two children who are in school. She operates a child care center to earn a living. She has been operating this center for two years and has employed two people. She also does farming to supplement her income.
Florence dreams of running a school in the future and employing more teachers. She has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy desks.

loans.use: to buy desks.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 29 years old and married with 4 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

Elizabeth has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Denis es originario del municipio turístico de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua. Es un pequeño comerciante de la zona que se dedica a vender carne de res desde hace cinco años, donde obtiene ingresos para contribuir económicamente para los gastos del hogar.
Sin embargo actualmente necesita crédito de ceprodel para comprar carne de res de contado en un 100%, y adquirir una variedad de carne de calidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, es importante mencionar que el atiende a establecimientos de comidas ubicados en las playas de san Rafael del sur. Un lugar muy conocido por los nicaragüenses y extranjeros por sus bellas y tranquilas playas.

Antes de trabajar por cuenta propia él se dedicaba a la agricultura y a vender mariscos de forma ambulante, por lo que sus aspiraciones es hacer crecer su negocio y vender diferentes tipos de carne como carne de pollo, de cerdo y mariscos. Su estado civil es casado, y tiene dos niños a su cargo, uno en edad escolar
texts.en:
Denis is from the tourist town of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, Nicaragua.  He is a small business owner in the area who has worked selling beef for five years.  This is where he earns income to contribute to the household expenses.
However, he currently needs a loan from CEPRODEL to pay 100% for beef bought on credit and add a variety of quality meats to satisfy his customers' needs.  It is important to mention that he provides food establishments along the beaches of San Rafael del Sur.  This place is a well-known to Nicaraguans and foreign tourists for its beautiful and peaceful beaches.

Before he began working on his own, he worked in agriculture and selling seafood in the street.  His goal is to grow his business and sell different types of meat like chicken, pork, and seafood.  He is married and has two children, one is school age.

loans.use: to buy beef.

loans.name: Gantamir

texts.en:
Gantamir, 39, lives in Ulaanbaatar with his wife and two daughters, the older of whom is a secondary student. He has operated a delivery service since 2001 while his wife works for a local private company.

Gantamir inherited their house from his father. The house is now getting old and is cold in wintertime. He is now applying for a 2,000,000 MNT loan from XacBank to repair it before winter. With the loan he plans to buy a vacuum, new windows, heating and wallpaper for his house.

loans.use: to buy a vacuum, new windows, heating and wallpaper for his house.

loans.name: Marina's Group

texts.en:
Marina is 54 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 
Marina is engaged in the fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used for purchasing additional fish for sale. 
Marina has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Marina hopes to expand her business. Marina is the leader of a 3 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to be used for purchasing additional fish to sell

loans.name: Natsagdorj

texts.en: Mr. Natsagdorj, who is 32 years old, lives with his wife and three children in a little house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Their children are little and all stay home. His wife helps him with his business. He started a recycled materials sales business in 2005. He sells plastic, cans, and glass scrap. He transports his business products, and he conducts his transportation business in his mini truck. He is a humble man who says, "I am attempting to expand my business." He is requesting 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase spare machine parts and more recycled materials.

loans.use: To purchase spare machine parts and more recycled materials

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 37 years old, married to Caroline and they are blessed with five school going children. His wife is a housewife. He has been in business for sixteen years now earning an income of 13,000 KES per month.

This will be his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase metal materials for his carpentry business. He will use the anticipated profit to open up more businesses. 

He hopes to satisfy his clients by having all the items they need.

loans.use: to purchase more metals to support his business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 30 years. Elizabeth earns more income from her general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Rhoda works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Rhoda is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her business for her motorcycle transport business.

Rhoda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her business.

loans.name: Ruthly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 2 children, Ruthly works hard to support her family.

She has a rice grinder business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ruthly is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance for her rice grinder business.

Ruthly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Kithinji

texts.en:
Kithinji is a 56-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is married to Mercy who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past ten years with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn works hard to support her family. Romelyn is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Romelyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Romelyn has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Romelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Celma

texts.en:
Celma is 30 years old and married with 5 children.

Celma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a pearl vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional pearls and other accessories for her business.

Celma has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pearl vending business for 20 years.

Celma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional pearls and other accessories for her business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with 9 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elisa is 55 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Elisa has a bakery business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery.
                                                                                                        
Elisa has been in this business for 26 years. In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

loans.name: Mercy Ijang

texts.en:
Mercy Ijang is married with four children. They they live in a four-room house in Mbengwi Momo Division, North West Region Cameroon. She has faced many challenges in life, including the death of both parents when she was still a teenager, sickness of children and being unable to provide medication for them. 
Since she joined GHAPE in 2010, she has improved her standard of living by putting in place 12 decisions. She has taken out and repaid her one loan successfully. This lady is very hard working and is determined to educate all four of her children at the higher level of education. She is involved with buying and selling fashion dresses in Mbon Market Park Mbengwi and promises that if given the new loan she will expand her business by adding jewelry, sandals, ladies slippers and also baby wear. She is very positive that her business will succeed because the demand for her fashions is very high in that locality. She has regular customers and she always supplies goods to them at low prices so that they can resale and make their own profit. She has been running the business for five years and understands the techniques and tactics needed to capture and maintain both old and new customers. She strongly believes that from this business activity, the community will benefit from low prices, regular supplies and availability of high quality products.
With the profit generated from this loan, Mercy Ijang promises to further the education of her children and grandchildren, improve the living standard of her family with the support of her husband and provide medication to the family. She says she prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rate, borrowers are educated on managing the loan disbursement and the organization, apart from giving loans, encourages its members with social activities.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, jewelry, sandals, ladies slippers, baby wear.

loans.name: Sureyya

texts.en:
Ms. Sureyya is a 46-year-old married woman. Life is hard for her as her husband is not in good enough shape to be employed.  She is a courageous lady and didn’t lose hope. She started her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation by purchasing a buffalo.  She now has 5 cows and a good milk-selling business.  She has a lot of clients.

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle and requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy one more cow to meet the increasing demands of her clients. She intends to utilize the profits for the treatment of her husband.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to meet the increasing demands of her clients

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Jeune homme célibataire de 27ans, Mr Koffi est revendeur de profession. Il vend les produits de premières nécessités (riz, huile végétale, sucre, lait, tomate) à domicile et est aidé par 01 personne. Son second crédit qu’il sollicite chez nous, lui servira à acheter en quantité considérable des marchandises. Elle veut réinvestir dans son activité, vendre en gros pour permettre à ses clients d’acheter à un prix considérable et se marier plus tard.
texts.en: A 27-year-old single man, Koffi is a merchant by trade.  He sells staple products (rice, vegetable oil, sugar, milk, tomatoes) door to door with the aid of one other person.  This loan that he is requesting, his second, will allow him to buy a large quantity of products.  He wants to reinvest in his business, sell in large quantities to allow his customers to buy at a good price, and he would like to marry in the future.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: La Delivrance 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Lazare, age 57, is married with five children, ages 7 to 32 years old. He has two children currently attending school. Lazare is representing the La Deliverance 2 (#1) group. He owns a small bakery and cafe. He has had this small business for two years. He will use the loan to buy fish, chicken, and beef. His business strategy is to sell the bread and food that customers prefer. 
This is Lazare’s first loan from Kiva’s partner, HOPE Congo. His group and HOPE are confident he will use the loan wisely and be able to repay it.

loans.use: to pay for fish, chicken, and beef.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 7 De Septiembre que se reúne cada 15 días en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.

En este lugar vive la señora Julia, tiene 73 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo siete hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, seis aun vive en su casa con sus familias.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y la mayoría de sus productos los vende bajo pedidos, trabaja tres días a la semana en las entregas y cobros ya que deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 12  años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende es el Vita toro, hepalive, los purgantes, el PH, entre otros ya que son muy buenos.

Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que el anterior fue de mucha ayuda porque estuvo bastante enferma y si no hubiera sido por las ganancias que le da su negocio no hubiera tenido para los gastos de médico y medicinas. Este crédito es para comprar productos naturales. Este es el tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le ha brindado la institución.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante hasta que Dios se lo permita.
texts.en:
The September 7th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches. There are many visitors who come throughout the year since Manta is a city that has unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Sra. Julia lives in this place. She is 73 years old and her husband died several years ago. Julia has seven grown children. Six of them live at her house with their families.

Julia sells natural products by going door-to-door. Most of her products are sold by accepting orders. She works three days a week by making deliveries and taking payments since her products are offered on credit. Julia collects payment every eight days. She has been in business for more than 12 years and has done very well. The products she sells the most are Vita Toro, Hepalive, laxatives, PH, and other items. Her other products have also sold very well.

Julia is requesting another loan since her previous one was a great help. She had been quite ill, so she was able to use the profits from her business to pay for her medical expenses and medicines. This loan will be used to buy natural products. Julia is receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank and she enjoys the assistance provided by Fundación ESPOIR. Her dream is to move forward as God will allow.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Yaciris Del Socorro

texts.es: Yaciris con su credikiva compró al por mayor y de contado, zapatos deportivos y colegiales, sandalias y chancletas para caballeros, damas e infantil. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, porque hay nuevos diseños ajustados a la moda que debe exhibir, porque su clientela le gusta todo lo que signifique cambio y modernidad.  Comprará entonces, calzado femenino, masculino, e infantil porque se acerca el segundo semestre del año, temporada en la que se incrementan sus ventas de estilos actualizados y usualmente se elevan significativamente las ventas impactando las utilidades del año positivamente. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Muchas gracias, por apoyarme “Dios los bendiga, siempre, para que me sigan apoyando. “
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Yaciris purchased, sports shoes, school shoes, sandals, and flip flops wholesale on a cash basis for men, women, and children. At the present time she is applying for a new Kiva loan because there are new styles in fashion that she must display because her customers like everything that signifies change and modernity. She will buy women's, men's and children's footwear because it's close to the second half of the year, the season when there is an increase in sales of modern styles. This significantly increases overall sales which positively impacts annual profits. Her message to her Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you very much for supporting me. May God bless you, always, that you continue to support me."

loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's footwear

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has five children and has been doing agricultural work for 15 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, crops, and transportation services. She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is being her own boss and feeding the cows is her passion. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of inputs and animal feeds. Animals on the farm have been given the names of lelgina, cheptuigong, asyier, lelmet.  In local language these mean white tummy, dark eyes, black and white one and the one with the white forehead, respectively.

Jane chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan after hearing about the program from existing members. This client learned about credit management during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session.

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. As a result of the loan, Jane said her income will increase and she will be able to educate her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jane owns the following: cow, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle but does not own pig, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net and running water but does not have electricity, solar power, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells clothes to earn a living. She had previously acquired a loan of 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. With the additional income, she was able to support her family and add more stock to her business. She dreams of expanding her business and owning a vehicle in the future. She is requesting for a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's suits to sell.

loans.name: La Delivrance 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Rock, age 32, is married with a 3-year-old child. He represents the La Delivrance 2 (#2) group. Rock owns a small car parts shop. He has been operating this business for over five years. He will use the loan to buy oil filters and other car parts the shop is low on. His business strategy is to regularly visit car garage shops to see if they are needing more supplies. He is proactive in selling his products and is willing to bring them to the garage. 
This is Rock's first loan from Kiva' partner, HOPE Congo. His group and HOPE are confident he will repay the loan. He hopes to build a large car parts boutique in the future.

loans.use: to pay for oil filters and other car parts.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en: Mrs. Mendbayar is 62 years old and lives with her husband in a small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband is a cutter at a private company. When she was a sewing master at a company for seven years, she acquired experience in the bed linen and ger-coverings production business. She is planning to start her business at home. She will sew chifforobes and blankets.  She requested a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase fabric and two sewing machines to start her business. She is a hardworking and honest woman.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and two sewing machines to start her business

loans.name: Susana Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La señora Susana es habitante del municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua. Tiene un negocio de servicios de alquiler de cuadra ciclo y un local de venta de comida, brindando su trabajo a personas que visitan las hermosas y bellas de san Rafael del sur en busca de recreación familiar, disfrutar de un rico baño en el mar y de sabrosas comidas nicaragüenses.
Necesita efectivo para adquirir unas llantas nuevas para brindarle mantenimiento preventivo a su herramienta de trabajo (cuadra ciclo), y así poder brindarle un servicio seguro y de calidad a las personas que demandan de diversión.
Antes de tener esta actividad comercial, ella se dedicaba a vender pescados de forma ambulante de casa en casa y con esfuerzos de su trabajo pudo ahorrar para poner este tipo de negocio que es muy atractivo para sus clientes.
Su estado civil es casada, tuvo nueve hijos, actualmente tiene siete con vida, ha sido una mujer muy esforzada y con deseos de superación personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Susana lives in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, Managua, Nicaragua. She has a service based business of renting a four wheeler and a locale where she sells food, providing her service to people visiting the beautiful San Rafael del Sur in search of family based recreation enjoying a rich bath in the sea and delicious Nicaraguan food. 

She needs the loan to get new tires to preventatively maintain her primary tool for her work (four wheeler) and provide a safe and quality service to those who are seeking fun. 

Before having this work, she used to sell fish house to house. With her efforts she was able to save in order to set up this business which is very attractive to her customers. 

She is married and has nine children, seven of whom are alive. She has been a very strong woman with the desire to improve herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy new tires and seafood.

loans.name: Les Aigles 2 Group

texts.en:
Leocadie, age 56, is married with 2 chidlren, ages 34 and 28 years old. He represents the Les Aigles 2 group. Leocadie sells used clothing in a local market. He has been operating this business for over 20 years. He has acquired many loyal customers and a good reputation in the market. He will use the loan to buy large bales of used clothing from his supplier. In Congo, used clothing is sold in large bails that come in from other countries. His business strategy is to open is stand early in the day and to give good customer service. 
Leocadie has received 4 previous loans from Kiva’ partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record.

loans.use: to pay for bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 26 years old, married, and blessed with a child. He runs an M-PESA call center, a business he started five years ago. He earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more calling cards to sell. The profit he makes will aid him in expanding his business as well as educating his child.

He dreams of owning a rental house within town.

loans.use: To puchase more calling cards to sell

loans.name: Lucy  Njeri

texts.en:
Lucy is 59 years old, a mother of three children. She sells clothes to earn a living. She has engaged in this business since the year 2009. 

She operates her business in a competitive environment with reliable customers.   Besides, she does farming to supplement her income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. 

Lucy has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy clothes.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training ground for Kenya's Olympic runners. She has one child, and she has been in farming for four years.  Her primary income sources are eggs, milk, and crops, which all go to the local market, and her employment salary. She will use the loan to buy irrigation pipes

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming:  "She loves keeping poultry and loves seeing chicks grow to big hens!" Her biggest challenge is "poultry diseases, which sometimes bring a lot of loses." The dairy cow on the farm has been named "Lelmet," which refers to one with white forehead.

Ruth was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "She heard from existing members." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session:  "She has learnt about record keeping."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Ruth replied:  "From the loan, she will be able to get more income and thus feed her family well and educate her child."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Ruth owns the following:  a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does NOT have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy irrigation pipes

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 21 años de edad, es muy trabajador y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, vive al lado de su madre quien ha sido su brazo derecho y quien le ha dado muchos ánimos para salir adelante. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, posee playas hermosas y atractivos turísticos como “las Islas Ballestas” y el “Candelabro de Paracas”, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho jugar futbol con sus amigos y vecinos de su barrio, asimismo le encanta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. 

Con mucho empeño y esfuerzo Juan trabaja en su pequeño negocio de servicio veterinario, ya que el logro terminar sus estudios de medicina veterinaria y desde hace un año trabaja en ello, el le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes de manera semanal; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con los clientes y porque le gusta lo que hace.

Juan agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar materiales quirúrgicos y medicamentos, así de esta manera el podrá atender de mejor manera a sus clientes y poder seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y un local para hacer una clínica veterinaria”.
texts.en:
Juan is a hardworking young man who is 21 years of age. He has plenty of drive to succeed. Juan lives with his mother, who serves as his right arm and has given him the motivation to move forward. His home is located in the city of Pisco, which is known for having a warm and pleasant climate. There are also beautiful beaches and tourist attractions such as “Las Islas Ballestas” and “Candelabro de Paracas”. Agriculture is developed in this area, particularly the cultivation of cotton, corn, and other crops. Whenever he has free time, Juan likes to play soccer with his friends and neighbors from the area. He also enjoys one of his favorite dishes, the flavorful “carapulcra con sopa seca” (a spicy Peruvian stew served with dried potatoes).

With great effort and determination, Juan works at his small business providing veterinary services. He already finished his studies in veterinary medicine and has been working for one year. In his business, he works approximately nine hours a day and can serve up to 15 clients per week. Juan believes he is doing well in his business because he is friendly with his clients and he enjoys what he does.

Juan is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to buy surgical supplies and medicines. This will enable him to provide better service to his clients and allow him to continue working. Juan continues to pursue his greatest dream of owning a house and finding a location for his veterinary clinic.

loans.use: to buy surgical supplies and medicines for his veterinary practice.

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron is 27 years old and a single business man. He has been a tailor for the past three years, with the monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to cater to his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Haron will use the loan to buy textile materials for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will support his parents. His hopes and dreams are to buy a sewing machine and employ some workers.

loans.use: to buy textile materials for his shop.

loans.name: Osorval

texts.en: Mr. Osorval lives with his wife and two children in a house in uptown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Tuulsuren, helps him with his business. His son is a college student, and his daughter goes to the secondary school. For the last 20 years, Mr. Osorval has been operating his own recycled materials business. Consequently, Mr. Osorval is well-experienced in the recycled materials trade business. His customers appreciate him as a good businessman and hardworking person. He wants to expand his business, and he needs 4,000,000 MNT to purchase another car to transport recycled materials to the trade center. As a result of this expansion, he expects major improvements in his family's living situation.

loans.use: To purchase another car to transport recycled materials

loans.name: Wendy

texts.es: Wendy de 21 años de edad se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza, inventario que sus clientes encuentran en un sitio de su vivienda,  ubicada al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde vive con su cónyuge. Ella recuerda que  inició su  negocio el 26 de Mayo del 2011,  atendiendo la sugerencia de sus amigos y porque además posee conocimientos en los productos de belleza y que su negocio poco a poco ha ido ganando muchos clientes, porque además de vender producto capilares, también ofrece secadores, planchas de cabellos, queratinas, masajes capilares, champoo, silicona  y perfumería. Wendy realiza sus ventas a crédito, de lunes a domingos y trabaja hasta que el cliente lo requiera. Para realizar su estrategia comercial,  visita a sus potenciales compradores y tiene una guía especializada mediante la cual ofrece sus productos, los clientes solicitan el pedido y ella a su vez pide la mercancía a su proveedor de revistas, para responder el pedido,  en un periodo de tiempo promedio no mayor de 30 días. Sus  clientes son sus vecinos, amigos y referidos que compran a ella con mucha frecuencia. Su principal meta es alcanzar el doble de su clientela y por eso se esmera en darle una pronta respuesta a ella, pero su principal desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr responder a sus expectativas de acortar el tiempo de respuesta lo cual le impide crecer. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará secadores, planchas, masajes, productos capilares perfumería y productos de limpieza capilar. Con su credikiva, logrará tener un stock de mercancía con el cual reducir el tiempo de respuesta de su clientela y poco a poco, contar con un capital de trabajo independiente para estar mucho mas holgada.
texts.en:
Wendy, 21, sells beauty products to customers from her house, where she lives with her husband in the southwestern part of the city. She started the business on May 26, 2011 at the suggestion of her friends and because she was knowledgeable about cosmetics. Slowly, she built a client base because, in addition to selling hair care products, she offered dryers, hair irons, keratins, hair massagers, shampoo, silicone solutions, and perfumes.

Wendy sells on credit and works from Monday to Sunday as her customers need her. Her business strategy is to visit her potential customers and show them a catalog of products. Customers place their orders, and then she orders the merchandise from the suppliers. On average, the orders are filled in no more than 30 days. Her customers are her neighbors, friends, and referrals who buy regularly. Her main goal is to double her client base and, therefore, she strives to respond quickly to her customers. Her main challenge, however, is insufficient working capital to respond promptly to her cutomers' needs, which impedes her growth. Therefore, she has requested a Kiva loan to buy dryers, irons, massagers, hair care products, perfumes, and shampoos. The loan will allow her to keep stock and reduce the response time to her customers' orders. Slowly, she will build her own working capital and be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy dryers, irons, massagers, hair care products, perfumes, and shampoos.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim is a 48 year old man living in Lebanon. He got married to Nadia, a wonderful and supportive woman. They have only one child attending school. His greatest dream is to offer his child a better life, especially with being the main income provider in the family. 

Abdel Karim has been working at a local gas station. As for his wife, she has worked as a teacher at a local school for 15 years.  Through their jobs, they will be able to cover their child's study fees as best they can. Despite that, Abdel Karim finds it really hard to stand on his own. 

To help him continue paying his child’s education fees, he asks a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l.  In that way, he will help his child achieve a good educational level, even pursue higher degrees. With this opportunity, his child will start his own business and no doubt create a better and new way of living.

loans.use: To continue paying his child’s education fees.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
La señora Rosa es habitante del municipio de san Rafael del sur, Managua, Nicaragua. Tiene un negocio de reparación de llantas de todo tipo de vehículo, motocicleta y bicicleta, además de vender repuestos de bicicletas, tiene siete años de dedicarse a esta labor donde obtiene ingresos para solventar los gastos familiares.
Actualmente necesita financiamiento para terminar de construir su casa de habitación, ya que necesita de materiales tales como: arena, cemento y laminas de zinc.
Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y cosméticos de forma ambulante de casa en casa, y sus sueños era tener su propio negocio personal y poder construir su propia vivienda digna para su familia.
Su estado civil es casada, tiene un niño y tiene treinta años de edad.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the municipal of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua. She has a business repairing tires for all kinds of vehicles, motorcycles and bicycles, she also sells bicycle parts and she has been working in this capacity for 7 years, from which she receives income that helps her pay for her domestic expenses. 
Currently, she needs financing to complete construction on her house, she needs materials like sand, cement and zinc sheets.
Before, she sold clothing and cosmetics as a traveling saleswoman from door to door and her dreams were to have her own personal business and to be able to build her own home decent enough for her family. 
She is married, she has one child and is thirty years old.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials like sand, cement and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 39-year-old mixed crop farmer. He is a divorced man with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past six years with the monthly income of KES. 20,900, which he uses to support his children.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Richard will use the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a dairy cow. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children up to university level and improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase construction material to begin construction on the entrance to his home.

loans.name: Ruth Noemi

texts.es:
La señora Ruth de 55 años de edad es viuda, vive con su hija en su casa de habitación ubicada en la comunidad de Nacaome, Valle, se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de la costura ella elabora prendas de vestir como vestidos, faldas, trajes para quince años, bodas y otros.
Doña Ruth esta solicitando el préstamo de 8,500.00 lempiras para comprar telas y accesorios que ella necesita para elaborar sus productos.
Doña Ruth Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento y poder mejorar de esta manera sus ingresos.
Su sueño es que su hija se le gradué de la universidad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Ruth is 55 years old and is a widow, she lives with her daughter in her house that is located in the community of Nacaome, Valle, she has been working in this capacity for some years now; she has a sewing business where she has been making dresses, skirts and suits for fifteen years for weddings and more. Ruth is asking for a loan for 8,500 lempiras to purchase fabric and accessories that she needs to make her product. Ruth, with the help from this loan, wants to supplement her financial needs and to be able to improve her profits. Her dream is to see her daughter graduate from university. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras-August 2012.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and accessories for her business.

loans.name: Umar

texts.ru:
Умар проживает в районе Б. Гафурова города Худжанд. Он живет с женой. Его жена домохозяйка. Сын Умара занимается капитальным ремонтом квартир. 
Умар предоставляет услугу. Он пять лет назад приобрел грузовой автомобиль на котором до сегодняшнего дня занимается перевозками. Умар очень хороший человек, он старается обеспечить свою семью всем необходимым. 
Умар просит кредит для ремонта грузового автомобиля и приобретения новой легковой автомашины. Он хочет продолжит свою деятельность, также хочет работать таксистом.
texts.en:
Umar lives in the Bobojon Ghafurov area of the city of Khujand. He lives with his wife, who stays at home. Umar's son renovates apartments for a living.
Umar works in the service industry. Five years ago he purchased a truck that he's been using to transport goods.
Umar is a good person and tries to provide for his family well. He has requested a loan to repair his truck and to buy a new car. He wants to maintain his business and also to start a taxi business.

loans.use: to repair his truck and to purchase a new car

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms. Sharifan is a 51-year-old married woman and has enjoyed the work of making Parandas for so many years. Paranda is considered as a traditional hair accessory in a country like Pakistan.  Women use it for a traditional look on special occasions like Eid (a holiday) and weddings. She makes beautiful Parandas, especially for bridal hairstyles. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear.

She is striving hard to meet her family expenditures.  She is responsible for providing them a good environment with good food, clothing, and education. 

She needs a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy raw material including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment. This would help in attracting more customers. She desires to utilize the earned revenue for building a separate room for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including colorful threads, beads, mirrors, and pearls for embellishment for parandas (traditional hair accessories).

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Ms Sakina, a 46-year-old married mother of six, successfully runs her hand embroidery business from her home. Her stitches are much in demand and appreciated by her customers, most of whom are her neighbors. Her husband is a sales person who earns insufficient income to support his family. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Sakina is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Sakina has gradually improved her business through support from the Kashf Foundation and is now requesting a loan of Rs. 30000/- to purchase a stock of threads in various colors with pearls and sequins to meet the increasing demand. She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of threads in various colors with pearls and sequins to meet increasing demand.

loans.name: Diluvina

texts.es:
La señora Diluvina de 31 años de edad, es madre de un hijo que depende de ella y de su conyugue quien actualmente radican en la comunidad de Nacaome, al sur de Honduras, dedicándose ella junto con su conyugue a la venta de frutas, verduras en la inmediación del mercado de Nacaome.
Diluvina esta solicitando el préstamo de 5,000.00 lempiras para comprar algunas frutas como Sandias, Piñas, Papayas, Melones, Bananos, Naranjas, Cocos y Manzanas que sus clientes le están solicitando.
Diluvina con el apoyo de este préstamo ella desea suplir la necesidad de financiamiento y atender mejor a sus clientes porque tendrá suficiente producto para suplir las necesidades de ellos.
El sueño de Diluvina es tener su propia casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Diluvina, 31 years old, is the mother of a son who is dependent on her and her husband. They are currently settled in the community of Nacaome in the southern part of Honduras. She and her husband sell fruit and vegetables in the vicinity of the Nacaome market.

Diluvina is applying for a loan of  5,000 HNL (Honduran lempira) in order to purchase fruit such as watermelon, pineapple, papayas, melons, bananas, oranges, coconuts and apples, which her customers have requested. With the help of this loan she wants to satisfy her funding needs and better care for her customers because then she will have sufficient products to meet their demands. 

Diluvina’s dream is to have her own home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - August of 2012.

loans.use: to purchase watermelons, pineapples, papayas, melons, bananas, oranges, coconuts and apples for her business.

loans.name: Ser-Od

texts.en:
Ser-Od is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in Hovd province of Mongolia. 

In 2005, Ser-Od started a sewing business. She produces the Mongolian national clothes and socks, slippers, and underlining made from wool. Mostly she takes orders from people and makes clothes. Her mom helps her business. 

Now she has many orders from customers for underlining because winter will come soon. She needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase raw materials to make underlinings. 

She is well-experienced in her own business. Her attitude is good.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make underlining.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 46 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora. Es madre de dos hijas a quienes crió y educó sola, ya que desde hace varios años se separó del que fue su conviviente por mucho tiempo. Vive en su casa propia y trabaja mucho, pues desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y a su nieto de 4 años a quien cría.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de ropa de segundo uso. Ella selecciona las prendas que están en mejor estado, luego separa las femeninas de las masculinas y finalmente distribuye aquellas que son de niños y adultos. Semanalmente se traslada, en compañía de una amiga, hacia los caseríos y centros poblados lejanos para vender su mercadería. Lleva en este negocio más de 13 años y le va muy bien. Adicionalmente tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede viajar por distintos lugares y traer también diversos productos que le regalan o intercambia con los pobladores de los caseríos. Recuerda que se inició con este negocio debido a los bajos ingresos que había en su hogar y esto ocasionaba que no pueda brindarles una buena educación a sus hijas, pero desde que empezó a trabajar con lo que hace hasta ahora, las cosas mejoraron mucho. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP y agradece a todas aquellas personas que lo hacen posible. Se siente a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera que es un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado, 2000 soles, comprará más ropa para seguir con su negocio. También comprará frutas, golosinas y bebidas para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
Doris is 46 years old.  She is a friendly, good and hard-working woman.  She has two daughters, who she raised and educated on her own.  A number of years ago, she separated from her long-term partner.  She now lives in her own home and works a lot; she wants to give a better quality of life to her daughters and to her 4-year old grandson, who she is raising. 

Doris works selling second-hand clothing.  She selects the garments that are in the best condition, then separates the women's from the men's, and finally distributes the clothing, both children's and adult's.  On a weekly basis, Doris travels with a friend to the villages and out-lying towns to sell her merchandise.  She has been in this business for over 13 years, and it is going very well.  Additionally, Doris has a small grocery that she runs out of her home.  Doris likes her work because she can travel to different places and bring back various products that the people give to her or that she trades for in the villages.  Doris recalls that she started her business because her household's low income meant that she couldn't give her daughters a good education.  But since she started working at her current business, things have gotten a lot better. 

This is Doris's second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for all those who have made it possible for her to get a loan.  She feels satisfied with her communal bank; she feels that it's a united and supportive group.
With the sum she has requested of 2000 soles (USD $775), Doris will purchase more clothing for her business.  She will also purchase fruit, sweets and beverages for her grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for her business.  She will also purchase fruit, sweets and beverages to stock up her store.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal REYNA DEL CARMEN; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.

La socia Livia , la socia tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz,azucar,leche,golosinas,gaseosas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día  a su negocio ,la socia trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 06:00am hasta las 09:00pm aproximadamente ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante y apoya a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como gaseosas.

Los otros socios se dedican a la venta de cds, restaurante, venta de ceviche, venta de artesania, crianza de animales menores, venta de zapatos.

La socia se  siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This group belongs to the communal bank "Reyna Del Carmen"; this bank is located in the department of Cusco, Peru. 

One group member, Livia, is 27 years old, has two children, and lives with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store, where she sells different types of products like rice, sugar, milk, sweets, soft drinks and more. Livia has been in this business a long time, which is going well thanks to the commitment that she puts in each day. She works Monday to Saturday from approximately 6:00 am to 9:00 pm. Livia is an earnest and responsible person and in this way she goes forward and supports her family. 

Livia is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise such as soft drinks. 

The other members of the communal bank make a living in the sale of CDs, ceviche, crafts, and shoes, and in animal breeding and running a restaurant. 

Livia is grateful for the loan given and commits to comply with the established repayment instalments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like soft drinks

loans.name: Prosperemos- Cusco Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal PROSPEREMOS -CUSCO; este banco está situado en el departamento de Cusco.
